item.title: 情報筋の話：NYTは、GoogleがNews Showcaseを含む自社のプラットフォームでTimesのコンテンツを紹介できるようにする契約の一環として、Googleから3年間で1億ドルを得る（Alexandra Bruell/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Alexandra Bruell / Wall Street Journal:
Sources: NYT is getting ~$100M from Google over three years as part of a deal allowing Google to feature Times content on its platforms, including News Showcase  —  Deal covers distribution, subscriptions, marketing and ad products  —  The New York Times is getting around $100 million …

item.title: AMP規格でメディア企業にとってより良い、より速いモバイルウェブを作ろうとしたグーグルの試みは、インターネット大手に対するパブリッシャーの信頼を台無しにする結果になった（David Pierce/The Verge）。
item.description:
David Pierce / The Verge:
How Google's attempt to create a better, faster mobile web for media companies with the AMP standard ended up ruining publishers' trust in the internet giant  —  Google promised to create a better, faster web for media companies with a new standard called AMP.  In the end, it ruined the trust publishers had in the internet giant.

item.title: 2023年ピューリッツァー賞受賞者一覧（調査報道部門WSJ、国民報道部門WaPo、国際報道部門NYTなど）（The Pulitzer Prizes
item.description:
The Pulitzer Prizes:
List of 2023 Pulitzer Prize winners, including WSJ for Investigative Reporting, WaPo for National Reporting, and NYT for International Reporting  —  New York, NY (May 8, 2023) — Columbia University today announces the 2023 Pulitzer Prizes, awarded on the recommendation of the Pulitzer Prize Board.

item.title: ピューリッツァー賞16賞のうち4賞が汚職を報じる地元メディアに、SpotifyのGimlet Mediaがオーディオ報道で受賞、初のピューリッツァー賞（Sara Fischer/Axios)
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Four of the 16 Pulitzer Prize awards went to local outlets reporting on corruption; Spotify's Gimlet Media won for audio reporting, its first Pulitzer Prize  —  The 2023 Pulitzer Prize winners were announced Monday, with four of the 16 awards for journalism across 15 categories …

item.title: 2023年ピューリッツァー賞受賞者リスト：WSJは調査報道部門、ワシントン・ポストは国内報道部門、NYTは国際報道部門、他（AP通信社）
item.description:
Associated Press:
The 2023 Pulitzer Prize winners list: WSJ for Investigative Reporting, The Washington Post for National Reporting, NYT for International Reporting, and more  —  The Pulitzer Prizes recognizing the best of journalism and the arts in 2022 were announced Monday.

item.title: Fox Newsは、Tucker Carlsonの退社後、午後8時の枠に40以上の新しい広告主が入り、この枠に広告主を完全に戻すことを望んでいると述べている（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
Fox News says 40+ new advertisers came into the 8pm slot since Tucker Carlson's exit and it hopes to bring back a full complement of advertisers to the slot  —  Tucker Carlson is out at 8 p.m. on Fox News Channel, and the network hopes that a host of blue-chip advertisers that for years avoided …

item.title: メモです：Puck News共同創業者兼CEOのJoe Purzycki氏が退社、2023年上半期のこれまでの広告収入は前年比200％増、購読者は「過去1年で2倍以上」（Sara Fischer/Axios)
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Memo: Puck News co-founder and CEO Joe Purzycki is leaving, H1 2023 ad revenue so far is up 200% YoY, and subscribers “more than doubled during the past year”  —  Puck News co-founder and CEO Joe Purzycki is leaving the company, according to an internal note sent from co-founder …

item.title: アマゾン、Amazon MGM Studios Distributionを立ち上げ、同社の映画やテレビ番組をプライム・ビデオ以外のストリーミングサービスや飛行機内でレンタルまたは購入できるようにする（Christopher Palmeri/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Christopher Palmeri / Bloomberg:
Amazon launches Amazon MGM Studios Distribution to offer its movies and TV shows for rent or purchase on streaming services besides Prime Video and on airplanes  —  Amazon.com Inc. is launching a new unit to distribute its movies and TV shows to other media outlets besides its Prime Video streaming service.

item.title: The CWを所有するNexstarは、CBSの8局がCWとの提携を解消した数日後に、サンディエゴのKUSI-TVとチャンネル51を$35Mで買収する予定です（Dade Hayes/Deadline）。
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Nexstar, which owns The CW, plans to acquire San Diego's KUSI-TV and Channel 51 for $35M, days after eight CBS stations shed their CW affiliations  —  Nexstar Media Group, which owns The CW and the largest group of local TV stations in the U.S., is adding an independent station in San Diego to its portfolio.

item.title: PubMatic、ブランドや代理店が直接取引でCTVやオンラインビデオの在庫を購入できるActivateを発表、DSPをカットして競争力を維持（Anthony Vargas/AdExchanger）
item.description:
Anthony Vargas / AdExchanger:
PubMatic launches Activate, which lets brands and agencies buy CTV and online video inventory through direct deals, cutting out DSPs to remain competitive  —  The line between the buy side and sell side of digital advertising is getting blurrier by the day.  Now PubMatic is crossing the aisle.

item.title: Dish Networkは、2022年第1四半期に462Kを失ったのに対し、第1四半期に〜552Kの純有料テレビ加入者を失い、Sling TV加入者210万人を含む合計920万人に減少したと報告（Ethane Vlessing/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Etan Vlessing / The Hollywood Reporter:
Dish Network reports losing ~552K net pay TV subscribers in Q1, compared to losing 462K in Q1 2022, declining to 9.2M total, including 2.1M Sling TV subscribers  —  The satellite TV company, led by chairman Charlie Ergen and CEO Erik Carlson, had a decline of 462,000 in the year-ago quarter.

item.title: 40人以上の科学者が、出版社エルゼビアの「強欲」に抗議して、論文1本あたり2,700ポンド以上の料金を請求する科学雑誌「ニューロイメージ」の編集委員を辞任（Anna Fazackerley/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Anna Fazackerley / The Guardian:
More than 40 scientists resign from the editorial board of science journal Neuroimage, which charges £2,700+ per paper, to protest publisher Elsevier's “greed”  —  Entire board resigns over actions of academic publisher whose profit margins outstrip even Google and Amazon

item.title: 米国中西部での調査で、地方紙の読者は、広告や法律上の告知を好む出版社よりも、イベントのような新しい収益のアイデアに前向きであることがわかった（Kristi Eaton/The Daily Yonder）。
item.description:
Kristi Eaton / The Daily Yonder:
A study in the US Midwest finds readers of rural newspapers are more open to new revenue ideas, like events, than publishers, who prefer ads and legal notices  —  There's a conflict between what weekly newspaper publishers think are the most likely ways their businesses will generate money …

item.title: ワーナー・ブラザース・ディスカバリーCTOのAvi Saxenaと最高製品責任者のTyler Whitworthに、Maxを一から構築したことや新機能などについてインタビュー（Lauren Forristal/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Lauren Forristal / TechCrunch:
An interview with Warner Bros. Discovery CTO Avi Saxena and Chief Product Officer Tyler Whitworth on building Max from the ground up, new features, and more  —  A few weeks before Warner Bros. Discovery launches its new HBO Max/Discovery+ streaming service, Max, TechCrunch spoke …

item.title: New York TimesのThe DailyやiHeartMediaのBlack EffectやMy Culturaなど、一部のエリートポッドキャストは、ここ数ヶ月、広告枠を埋めるのに苦労しています（Max Tani/Semafor）。
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Some elite podcasts, like the New York Times' The Daily and iHeartMedia's Black Effect and My Cultura, have struggled to fill their ad slots in recent months  —  The News  —  Some of the most listened-to podcasts in America are struggling to sell ads as the audio business shifts toward the vast, mostly independent, “mid-tail.”
